title: 113_s2764
content:
The "American Livestock Protection and Ranching Opportunity Act of 2014" emphasizes the importance of country-of-origin labeling for meat products to meet consumer demand and ensure food safety. Additionally, the Act prohibits the importation of fresh meat and meat products from countries with foot-and-mouth disease. SEC. 3 prohibits the importation of fresh meat and meat products from countries with foot-and-mouth disease until certified disease-free. SEC. 4 focuses on brucellosis research and compensation under the Livestock Disease Initiative. The Department establishes a livestock disease initiative to provide competitive grants for research and development to eligible entities such as Federal agencies, National Laboratories, and research institutions. Priority is given to research on diseases like bovine brucellosis and tuberculosis. Grant recipients must conduct research on surveillance methods, vaccines, and diagnostic tests for livestock diseases. The Department offers grants for research on surveillance methods, vaccines, and diagnostic tests for livestock diseases. Priority is given to proposals with matching funds, but it is not a requirement for receiving a grant. $5,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2015 to 2018. Assistance for losses due to brucellosis is provided to eligible livestock producers affected by quarantine of livestock due to brucellosis infection in the Greater Yellowstone area. Assistance under section 10407 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is provided to eligible livestock producers affected by brucellosis infection in the Greater Yellowstone Designated Surveillance Area. The payment rate for assistance is 60 percent of the monthly feed cost for the total number of livestock subject to quarantine. SEC. 5. LIVESTOCK INDEMNITY PAYMENTS.

Amends the Agricultural Act of 2014 to change indemnity payment rates for eligible livestock producers to 75 percent of the market value or nationwide price of applicable livestock.

SEC. 6. LIVESTOCK FORAGE DISASTER PROGRAM.

Amends the Agricultural Act of 2014 to allow for a price adjustment in monthly feed costs for high-value forage as determined by the Secretary.
